title-group.article-title: Single-Period Mean: Variance Analysis in a Changing World

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2003 Association for Investment Management and Research

abstract.p: Ideally, financial analysts would like to be able to optimize a consumption-- investment game with many securities, many time periods, transaction costs, and changing probability distributions. We cannot. For a small optimizable version of such a game, we consider in this article how much would be lost by following one or another heuristic that could be easily scaled to handle large games. For the games considered, a particular mean-variance heuristic does almost as well as the optimum strategy.
